seriesJson.title: Seminar: Big Sur
seriesJson.description: Discussion and lecture series from Esalen Institute at Big Sur, Calif., headed by Michael H. Murphy devoted to exploring the psychological nature of man.

node.title: Self-actualization and the peak experience, part two
node.description: This program, the second of two parts, presents a discussion led by Dr. Abraham Maslow of Brandeis University and author of Motivation of Personality, Toward a Psychology of Being, and Religions, Values and Peak Experiences.

node.title: Self-actualization and the peak experience, part one
node.description: This program, the first of two parts, presents a discussion led by Dr. Abraham Maslow of Brandeis University and author of Motivation of Personality, Toward a Psychology of Being, and Religions, Values and Peak Experiences.

node.title: LSD and human potentiality, part one
node.description: This program, the first of two parts, presents a discussion by Dr. Sidney Cohen, author of The Beyond Within, a survey of LSD research.

node.title: LSD and human potentiality, part two
node.description: This program, the second of two parts, presents a discussion by Dr. Sidney Cohen, author of The Beyond Within, a survey of LSD research.

node.title: Psychology of intimacy: Self-disclosure and authentic dialogue, part one
node.description: This program, the first of two parts, presents a conversation with Dr. Sidney Jourard, author of Personal Adjustment and The Transparent Self.

node.title: Psychology of intimacy: Self-disclosure and authentic dialogue, part two
node.description: This program, the second of two parts, presents a conversation with Dr. Sidney Jourard, author of Personal Adjustment and The Transparent Self.

node.title: Human potentiality and the evaluation process, part two
node.description: This program, the second of two parts, presents a lecture by Dr. Gardner Murphy, director of research, Menninger Foundation, Topeka, Kansas.

node.title: The individual and the intensive group experience, part one
node.description: This program, the first of two parts, presents the second portion of a discussion led by Dr. Carl Rogers, the principal founder of "client-centered therapy."
